page.title: 06Thurlow's crops livestock
page.content: Winter varieties of seed crops are favoured for their high yeilds. Wheat and barley are grown, wheat being sold mainly for flour. High quality barley is sold for malting for the brewing industry and the remainder for livestock feed. Also recent springs have been so wet and so late that spring planting has proved difficult. Straw is used for livestock litter, producing manure ad the stubble is usually ploughed in. Oilseed rape with its distinctive yellow blooms covering the land in early summer is also nowadays a main crop, being sold for vegetable oil, margarine, soap etc. Some land is put to grass for silage and also beans for cattle feed. Pure bred Hereford cattle a particular pride of the owner are kept at Thurlow Hall, and store cattle at Weston Woods which are fattened for slaughter
